definition[0]: a written document showing that someone has bought something
definition[1]: an official document giving details of something that someone has bought
example[0]: British ships can only be transferred by means of a bill of sale registered in the shipping register.
definition[2]: in former times, a document used by money lenders to claim property if a loan was not repaid
example[1]: He held a bill of sale over her furniture and put a man into her house to remove it.
